intro: Cyphostemma zanzibaricum, commonly known as the Zanzibar moonvine, is a climbing plant native to eastern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by bright red berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in coastal areas and along rocky outcrops. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
